SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelBoss, LevelOne, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
LevelParent is an abstract class that serves as the foundation for all game levels. It encapsulates common functionalities such as: - Managing the game loop with a timeline - Handling user input and controls - Spawning and managing enemy units and projectiles - Detecting collisions and updating the game state - Transitioning between levels or back to the main menu The class provides a structure for subclasses to define level-specific behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Constructor for the LevelParent class. Initializes the core components and game state required for a level.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - Name of the background image file to be used for the level.
      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      playerInitialHealth - The initial health value for the user's plane.
      stage - The primary stage on which the game will be displayed.

  • Method Details

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Initializes the game scene by setting up the background, friendly units, and UI elements. Adds functionality to handle key presses, such as toggling pause with the 'P' key.
      Returns:
      The initialized Scene object ready for gameplay.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by playing background music (if available) and initiating the game timeline. Also ensures the game background receives focus to capture user inputs.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Handles the transition to the next level in the game. Stops the current game timeline, logs the level transition, and notifies listeners of the change.
      Parameters:
      levelName - The name of the next level to transition to.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Retrieves the current game score.
      Returns:
      The player's current score.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a property change listener to the object. Listeners will be notified when properties change.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a property change listener from the object. Prevents the listener from receiving further property change notifications.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.
